titleInfo.title: Tennessee state gazetteer and business directory: Gruetli

location.physicalLocation: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University

mods.abstract: Gruetli. A Swiss settlement centrally located in Grundy county, 12 miles from Altamont, the county seat, and about 100 from Nashville. It was settled in 1869 and incorpo rated in 1870. Present population nearly 100. Baine’s creek supplies power for a corn and saw mill, and there are several artisans, a general store, Reform church, and German and English public school in the place. Tracy City, on the N. C. & St. L. Ry., is the shipping point. Mail is received daily. Christ. Marugg, postmaster. Business Directory. Bianchy, M., mason. Boesch, W., painter. Buettiker, Ferd., carpenter. Goelz, Abraham, saddler. Heer, H., butcher. Marugg, Martin, miller. Marugg, Rudolf, Saw Mill. Moritz, Car], General Store and Saloon. Von Rohr, L. B., blacksmith and wagon maker. Werner, Samuel, carpenter. Wichser, David, butcher.

titleInfo.title: Tennessee state gazetteer and business directory. Nashville, Tenn.: R.L. Polk & Co., 1877.

relatedItem.abstract: Tennessee’s history between the end of the American Civil War (1865) and the end of World War II (1945) often gets ignored. Citizenship—what that has meant and how that has changed—is at the heart of this digital exploration into Tennessee history and culture “between the wars." The stories you can explore through the objects, songs, photographs, paintings, and documents of this website are often those of challenges and obstacles placed before those who pursued the rights and benefits of citizenship.

mods.note: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University
